title: League freezes my computer
body:
I open the client, I load into a game. It fully loads and then it freezes my computer completely. 
Sounds are not playing in the background, it is completely frozen along with everything else. 

I have updated everything, put League into compatibility mode, etc. Nothing.

Please help.

Computer:

Windows 10
Intel Core i5-5200U
8GB RAM

replies.body: I can also vouch that this works! Just turned off the Game DVR to fix it. Thanks Riot & Spanqplank!

I can vouch for the solution Rubik provided in the message *Spanqplank* posted. You can find a guide on how to make this change [here](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html).

Let me know if it worked!

Possible solution
Rubik (Riot Games Player Support)
Aug 31, 11:41 PDT

Hey there, Spanqplank, I'm Rubik with Riot Technical Support. I'm sorry to hear that League has been freezing on your computer lately, I'll do my best to help you get your computer warm and toasty so you can play without a parka.

We've had many reports of Windows 10 players seeing dramatic FPS drops, freezes, crashes, and worse since a recent Windows 10 update - this seems to be specifically caused by a new feature. To resolve this go to your Xbox settings and disable the Game Bar/Game DVR.n:

This significantly boosted my fps and fixed the freezing.
